words.definition: A personal judgment that someone thinks is true, but that may be true or false.
words.sentence: It is my _____ that chocolate is better than vanilla.

words.definition: A story that teaches a lesson.
words.sentence: The _____ of the fable taught us that slow and steady wins the race.

words.definition: To talk someone into doing or believing something; convince.
words.sentence: I tried to _____ my parents to buy me a new video game.

words.definition: Can be added to the root of a word to change its meaning.
words.sentence: The prefix 'un-' is an _____ that changes 'happy' to 'unhappy'.

words.definition: The way in which things are arranged or put together.
words.sentence: We studied the _____ of the bridge to see how it was built.

words.definition: A group of words that a person knows or should know.
words.sentence: Reading books every day is a great way to expand your _____.

words.definition: Being a good and faithful friend, family member, or part of a group, no matter what happens.
words.sentence: The dog was very _____ and never left his owner's side.

words.definition: Not thinking and acting like you are better than others and giving credit to others.
words.sentence: Even though she won the contest, she remained _____ and thanked her team.

words.definition: Doing the right thing, even when no one is watching.
words.sentence: He showed _____ by returning the money he found on the floor.

words.definition: Building upon a topic of interest to make it more difficult and to make the learning last longer.
words.sentence: The teacher asked us to _____ our science project by adding a new experiment.
